title.narrative: Mechanism 14505 - STRENGHTENING INTERGRATED DELIVERY OF HIV/AIDS SERVICES(SIDHAS)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
SIDHAS aims to strengthen Nigerian government’s capacity to deliver sustainable HIV/AIDS services through increased access, improved quality and cross sectional integration, and improved stewardship by Nigerian institutions. In COP 14, SIDHAS will adopt a tired approach to the scale-up of HIV/AIDS treatment services. In Akwa-Ibom State (tier 1) the project will increase current on treatment by 50% Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.3: Biomedical Prevention - Blood Safety. Activities supporting a nationally-coordinated blood program to ensure a safe and adequate blood supply including: infrastructure and policies; donor recruitment activities, blood collection, testing for transfusion-transmissible infections, component preparation, storage and distribution; appropriate clinical use of blood, transfusion procedures and hemovigilance; training and human resource development; monitoring and evaluation; and development of sustainable systems. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.4: Biomedical Prevention - Injection Safety. Policies, training, waste-management systems, advocacy and other activities to promote medical injection safety, including distribution/supply chain, cost and appropriate disposal of injection equipment and other related equipment and supplies. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

SIDHAS aims to strengthen Nigerian government’s capacity to deliver sustainable HIV/AIDS services through increased access, improved quality and cross sectional integration, and improved stewardship by Nigerian institutions. In COP 14, SIDHAS will adopt a tired approach to the scale-up of HIV/AIDS treatment services. In Akwa-Ibom State (tier 1) the project will increase current on treatment by 50%, while in tier 2 state (Cross River, Rivers and Lagos states) it will increase current on treatment by 15%. In the remaining 11 maintenance states, the project will maintain current levels with minimal increase by 5%. SIDHAS will collaborate with the respective state governments to strategically scale up PMTCT services in tier 1&2 states. In Akwa-Ibom, the project will increase PMTCT coverage to 75% while increasing to 50 % in tier 2 states. In the remaining states, SIDHAS will seek to maintain current coverage for both PMTCT testing and ARV prophylaxis. CQI will be employed to improve service delivery in accordance with national standards and encourage systematic transition to greater GON responsibility. SIDHAS will enhance access to quality HIV/AIDS services through accredited capacity building events that further integrates services in different service delivery points. SIDHAS will promote collaboration and coordination at all levels through support to the SMTs, SITs, LITs, state procurement/logistic unit, state and LGA level integrated health data management teams; thereby enhancing skills transfer to enable government personnel gradually assume responsibility for these activities.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
